15/*! \file isc/backtrace.h
16 * \brief provide a back trace of the running process to help debug problems.
17 *
18 * This module tries to get a back trace of the process using some platform
19 * dependent way when available. It also manages an internal symbol table
20 * that maps function addresses used in the process to their textual symbols.
21 * This module is expected to be used to help debug when some fatal error
22 * happens.
23 *
24 * IMPORTANT NOTE: since the (major) intended use case of this module is
25 * dumping a back trace on a fatal error, normally followed by self termination,
26 * functions defined in this module generally doesn't employ assertion checks
27 * (if it did, a program bug could cause infinite recursive calls to a
28 * backtrace function). These functions still perform minimal checks and return
29 * ISC_R_FAILURE if they detect an error, but the caller should therefore be
30 * very careful about the use of these functions, and generally discouraged to
31 * use them except in an exit path. The exception is
32 * isc_backtrace_getsymbolfromindex(), which is expected to be used in a
33 * non-error-handling context and validates arguments with assertion checks.
34 */
35
36#ifndef ISC_BACKTRACE_H
37#define ISC_BACKTRACE_H 1
38
39/***
40 *** Imports
41 ***/
42
43#include <isc/types.h>
44
45/***
46 *** Types
47 ***/
48struct isc_backtrace_symmap {
49 void *addr;
50 const char *symbol;
51};
52
53LIBISC_EXTERNAL_DATA extern const int isc__backtrace_nsymbols;
54LIBISC_EXTERNAL_DATA extern const
55 isc_backtrace_symmap_t isc__backtrace_symtable[];
56
57/***
58 *** Functions
59 ***/
60
61ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
62isc_result_t
63isc_backtrace_gettrace(void **addrs, int maxaddrs, int *nframes);
64/*%<
65 * Get a back trace of the running process above this function itself. On
66 * success, addrs[i] will store the address of the call point of the i-th
67 * stack frame (addrs[0] is the caller of this function). *nframes will store
68 * the total number of frames.
69 *
70 * Requires (note that these are not ensured by assertion checks, see above):
71 *
72 *\li 'addrs' is a valid array containing at least 'maxaddrs' void * entries.
73 *
74 *\li 'nframes' must be non NULL.
75 *
76 * Returns:
77 *
78 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
79 *\li #ISC_R_FAILURE
80 *\li #ISC_R_NOTFOUND
81 *\li #ISC_R_NOTIMPLEMENTED
82 */
83
84isc_result_t
85isc_backtrace_getsymbolfromindex(int index, const void **addrp,
86 const char **symbolp);
87/*%<
88 * Returns the content of the internal symbol table of the given index.
89 * On success, *addrsp and *symbolp point to the address and the symbol of
90 * the 'index'th entry of the table, respectively. If 'index' is not in the
91 * range of the symbol table, ISC_R_RANGE will be returned.
92 *
93 * Requires
94 *
95 *\li 'addrp' must be non NULL && '*addrp' == NULL.
96 *
97 *\li 'symbolp' must be non NULL && '*symbolp' == NULL.
98 *
99 * Returns:
100 *
101 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
102 *\li #ISC_R_RANGE
103 */
104
105isc_result_t
106isc_backtrace_getsymbol(const void *addr, const char **symbolp,
107 unsigned long *offsetp);
108/*%<
109 * Searches the internal symbol table for the symbol that most matches the
110 * given 'addr'. On success, '*symbolp' will point to the name of function
111 * to which the address 'addr' belong, and '*offsetp' will store the offset
112 * from the function's entry address to 'addr'.
113 *
114 * Requires (note that these are not ensured by assertion checks, see above):
115 *
116 *\li 'symbolp' must be non NULL && '*symbolp' == NULL.
117 *
118 *\li 'offsetp' must be non NULL.
119 *
120 * Returns:
121 *
122 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
123 *\li #ISC_R_FAILURE
124 *\li #ISC_R_NOTFOUND
125 */
126ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
127
128#endif /* ISC_BACKTRACE_H */
129
